body:
Q1 You'll have plenty of English signs, and often even English speaking staff at major transport hubs in all the large cities.

Q2 There are machines where you might be able to buy an IC card with cre
summary: In major cities, transportation hubs often have English signs and staff. IC cards for transit can be purchased at machines.

body: you'll want to carry cash regardless or be willing to go to an ATM to pull out more any potential day. many places still only take cash.
summary: It's advisable to carry cash or be prepared to use ATMs, as many places still only accept cash.

body: I'd suggest staying overnight in Hiroshima and visiting Himeji on your way there or back. There's lots to see in Hiroshima. Kobe looks pretty uninteresting compared to Osaka and Hiroshima.
summary: Consider staying overnight in Hiroshima and visiting Himeji during the trip. Hiroshima offers many attractions, while Kobe may be less interesting compared to Osaka and Hiroshima.

body: usually the international driver permit is only valid for one year. is your friend sure it's still valid? Like if they got it a few months before leaving on the trip, it could be expired now.
summary: International driver permits are typically valid for one year. Verify the validity of the permit if obtained months before the trip.

body: Stick to the official government websites. If drugs aren’t on the official list of prohibited or controlled substances then there’s no restrictions on them.
summary: Refer to official government websites for a list of prohibited or controlled substances to understand travel restrictions on medications.

body:
Q1 You can eat for pretty cheap. 5000 yen per person per day can get you reasonable food, but you can go down to half if you eat like a student. 

Q2 https://www.japan-guide.com/e/e2157.html

Q3 I'm i
summary: A daily budget of 5000 yen per person can provide reasonable meals in Japan, with possibilities to spend less by opting for economical options.

body: Why not email them and ask?
summary: For specific inquiries, consider contacting the relevant parties directly via email.

body:
Yes, you can travel more cheaply if you organise everything yourself. And it's not hard; pretty much everyone on the sub is an independent traveller.

How much can you afford and what do you intend to
summary: Organizing travel independently can be more cost-effective than using travel agencies.

body:
Doing classes and organised tours always add a lot to the cost of travel.

Japan is an advanced economy, so the overall costs of visiting are going to be substantial even if you’re from a country with
summary: Participating in classes and organized tours can significantly increase travel costs, especially in economically advanced countries like Japan.

body: There are a bunch of guides available - I'd personally start with [japan-guide.com](http://japan-guide.com) and look at their recommended itineraries. You can easily spend less than $7,000 (or even $5
summary: For itinerary planning, start with resources like japan-guide.com which offers recommended itineraries and budgeting tips.

body: Just look at an example itinerary and book it yourself. I find this was half the price. Obviously it takes more of your time, that's why it costs more to pay an agency to do it for you.
summary: Planning and booking your own itinerary can be more economical than using a travel agency, though it requires more time.

body: Hire a photographer rather than expect random people to offer to do this for you for free
summary: For quality photographs during travel, consider hiring a professional photographer instead of relying on strangers.

body: This is very helpful, thank you so much! Welcome Suica app it is!
summary: The Welcome Suica app is recommended for managing travel funds and payments in Japan.

body: I tried this through the JAL site and it just didn't want to let me book anything that was domestic in Japan.
summary: Issues with booking domestic flights in Japan may arise from platform restrictions; consider using the airline's dedicated domestic services website.

body: I actually figured it out. It seems like it’s a bank authentication issue rather than visa thing. I switched from using my Chase card to Bank of America and it worked!
summary: Switching to a different bank's card may resolve payment authentication issues encountered with another bank.

body: Thank you very much!
summary: Expressing gratitude for helpful advice.

body: That's an excellent suggestion and I don't know why I didn't think of it that way. Thanks!
summary: Acknowledging and appreciating good travel advice.

body: thanks!
summary: Expressing thanks for received information.

body: I was looking at $5000 to travel by myself.  Looks like it's $7K through the travel agency.  And I admit I want to enjoy myself while I'm in japan.  But 7K does feel expensive to me.
summary: Comparing costs between self-organized travel and using travel agencies can highlight potential savings, with self-planned trips often being cheaper.

body: He said he'd be happy to pay for their time.
summary: Compensation for services can be negotiated to ensure fair payment for time spent.

body: Were you on the .jp site? If not, try that.
summary: For booking issues, using the regional (.jp) version of websites might provide better functionality.

body: i was able to book through the JAL site just a couple weeks ago for this coming week. you must be looking at the wrong site.
summary: Successful booking through the correct regional website indicates the importance of using the appropriate platform for services.

body: After flight tickets and hotel rooms for 2 weeks (splitting hotel room costs), I am still spending under half of that. For you, it shouldn't be over $3,000 for those alone, unless you are staying in n
summary: With careful budgeting, significant savings can be achieved on major travel expenses like flights and accommodations.

body: Hmm, I think I found the problem - I was trying to book too far in advance.  I tried with some closer dates and it appears to be working as intended!
summary: Booking issues might be related to attempting reservations too far in advance. Trying closer dates may solve the problem.

summary: Visiting Mt. Fuji during the climbing season offers a unique experience. Common questions and tips for this activity can be found on specialized forums and guides.
